Study Title: Study of Apatinib After Systemic Therapy in Patients With Hepatocellular Carcinoma(AHELP)
Brief Summary:
This was a multicenter, randomized, double-blind, phase III trial. This clinical study evaluates the efficacy and safety of Apatinib in patients with advanced liver cancer who have progressed on Systemic Therapy (Chemotherapy and/or Targeted Therapy).

Approximately 400 patients who meet the entry criteria will be randomly assigned in a 2:1 ratio to Apatinib or placebo (1/3 chance to receive placebo).

Primary endpoint of the study is overall survival.
Secondary Outcome Measures: Time to Progression（TTP）, Approximately 36 months|Progression Free Survival (PFS), Approximately 36 months|Objective Response Rate, Approximately 36 months|Disease Control Rate, Approximately 36 months
Study Design: Allocation: RANDOMIZED|Intervention Model: PARALLEL|Masking: TRIPLE (PARTICIPANT, CARE_PROVIDER, INVESTIGATOR)|Primary Purpose: TREATMENT
Locations: Jiangsu hengrui medicine CO. LTD, Lianyungang, Jiangsu, 222047, China
